thread.title: Trump aide Michael Flynn apologises over Russian envoy chats
thread.title_full: Trump aide Michael Flynn apologises over Russian envoy chats

title: Trump aide Michael Flynn apologises over Russian envoy chats
text:
Trump aide Michael Flynn apologises over Russian envoy chats 13 February 2017 Close share panel Image copyright Reuters Image caption Michael Flynn initially denied discussing sanctions but later said he could not be certain The US national security adviser has apologised to the vice-president for the controversy over his contact with a Russian envoy, the White House says. 
Michael Flynn came under scrutiny amid reports he spoke to the Russian ambassador to the US about sanctions before Donald Trump's inauguration. 
Vice-President Mike Pence publicly denied the allegations on behalf of the retired general. 
Mr Flynn has since told the White House that sanctions may have been discussed. 
Any discussion of sanctions could have violated laws against private citizens engaging in foreign policy. 
Mr Flynn appeared in the front row at President Trump's news conference on Monday with Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau. 
Mr Trump was not asked about Mr Flynn by the two reporters he called on, and evaded follow-up questions about the controversy as he left the room. 
Meanwhile, White House counsellor Kellyanne Conway maintained that Mr Flynn had "the full confidence of the president". 
"It's a big week for General Flynn. He's the point of contact for many of these foreign visits," she told MSNBC. Related Topics
